userStories.title: Create automatic migration from legacy ~/.brain-dump directory
userStories.description:
## Task
Implement automatic one-time migration from old `~/.brain-dump/` to new XDG paths.

## Migration Steps
1. Check if legacy `~/.brain-dump/` exists
2. Check if new XDG location already has data
3. If legacy exists and XDG empty:
   - Copy database to new location
   - Copy attachments to new location
   - Create `.migrated` marker in legacy dir
   - Log migration success
4. If both exist, warn user and use XDG

## Safety Measures
- Never delete legacy data automatically
- Create backup before migration
- Verify database integrity after copy
- Atomic operations where possible

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Migration runs automatically on first start
- [ ] Legacy data preserved (not deleted)
- [ ] Migration only happens once
- [ ] Error handling for failed migrations
- [ ] User informed of migration via log

## File to Create
`src/lib/migration.ts`

userStories.title: Add manual backup/restore CLI commands
userStories.description:
## Task
Add CLI commands for manual backup and restore operations.

## Commands
```bash
brain-dump backup              # Create immediate backup
brain-dump backup --list       # List available backups
brain-dump restore <filename>  # Restore from backup
brain-dump restore --latest    # Restore most recent backup
```

## Restore Safety
- Require confirmation for restore
- Create backup of current DB before restore
- Verify backup integrity before restore
- Show diff summary (ticket counts, etc.)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] `backup` command creates timestamped backup
- [ ] `backup --list` shows available backups with dates
- [ ] `restore` command works with confirmation
- [ ] Pre-restore backup created automatically
- [ ] Clear success/error messages

## File to Modify
`cli/brain-dump.ts`

userStories.title: Implement database lock file detection
userStories.description:
## Task
Add lock file mechanism to detect and handle multiple processes accessing the database.

## Lock File Location
`~/.local/state/brain-dumpy/brain-dumpy.lock`

## Lock File Contents
```json
{
  "pid": 12345,
  "startedAt": "2026-01-12T00:00:00Z",
  "type": "mcp-server" | "cli" | "vite"
}
```

## Behavior
- Create lock on database open
- Check if existing lock is stale (process not running)
- Warn if another process has lock
- Clean up lock on graceful shutdown
- Handle SIGTERM/SIGINT for cleanup

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Lock file created on DB access
- [ ] Stale locks detected and cleaned
- [ ] Warning shown for concurrent access
- [ ] Lock cleaned up on shutdown
- [ ] Works across MCP server, CLI, and Vite

## File to Create
`src/lib/lockfile.ts`

userStories.title: Add file-based logging system
userStories.description:
## Task
Implement file-based logging for debugging and audit trail.

## Log Location
`~/.local/state/brain-dumpy/logs/`

## Log Files
- `brain-dumpy.log` - Main application log (rotated)
- `mcp-server.log` - MCP server specific logs
- `error.log` - Errors only (for quick debugging)

## Log Format
```
2026-01-12T00:00:00.000Z [INFO] [mcp-server] Tool called: create_ticket
2026-01-12T00:00:00.000Z [ERROR] [database] Failed to write: SQLITE_BUSY
```

## Features
- Log levels: DEBUG, INFO, WARN, ERROR
- Automatic rotation (keep 5 files, 10MB each)
- Configurable log level via env var
- Async file writes (non-blocking)

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Logs written to XDG state directory
- [ ] Log rotation working
- [ ] All major operations logged
- [ ] Errors include stack traces
- [ ] LOG_LEVEL env var respected

## File to Create
`src/lib/logger.ts`

userStories.title: Add MCP tool for database health status
userStories.description:
## Task
Create MCP tool to report database health and backup status.

## Tool: `get_database_health`

## Returns
```json
{
  "status": "healthy" | "warning" | "error",
  "databasePath": "~/.local/share/brain-dumpy/brain-dumpy.db",
  "databaseSize": "15.2 MB",
  "lastBackup": "2026-01-11T00:00:00Z",
  "backupCount": 7,
  "integrityCheck": "ok",
  "activeConnections": 2,
  "lockFile": {
    "exists": true,
    "pid": 12345,
    "type": "mcp-server"
  },
  "issues": []
}
```

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Tool registered in MCP server
- [ ] Returns accurate health info
- [ ] Includes backup status
- [ ] Shows lock file info
- [ ] Lists any detected issues

## File to Modify
`mcp-server/index.js`
